text: one of the questions that people ask me
most at this time of year Thanksgiving
is how do I carve a turkey it's a little
intimidating but it's actually really
easy the first thing you have to do is
get it out of the roasting pan I like to
take a wooden spoon like this or just
something that I can get inside the
turkey and then something that's gonna
protect my hand from the heat because
well it does rest up here comes out of
the oven before you carve it about 20
minutes you want to protect your hand
because it's still gonna be hot so I use
my spoon to lift it up and then transfer
it to a cutting board there might be
some juices inside mine doesn't seem to
have that many but if it does you could
carefully tip it so that the juices go
back into the roasting pan and that's
what you'll use to make gravy the legs
on this one have been tied so cut those
apart we like to just tie the legs
together on our turkeys just for a nice
shape and even cooking and now there's
only really four steps to this the first
thing that you do is remove the leg
thigh piece from the turkey as a whole
so cut between the leg and the breast
and then just open it up just pull it
back until the thigh bone sort of pops
out of the joint there's a bone right
here if you cut right through that joint
it'll separate right away from the
carcass of the turkey for now I'm just
gonna put this aside on my platter when
I remove the second leg as well I'm
using a carving board which has a little
wealth to catch the juices as you carve
not just turkeys and chickens but other
big pieces of meat it's very helpful
it's not completely necessary but it
helps a little bit with not getting a
huge mess all over your counter and if
your turkey is really really hot you
might want to stabilize it not with your
hand but with a fork of some kind
once the legs have been removed you can
remove the breasts what you want to do
is cut along side of the ridge which is
the top of the breast bone cut down
along either side of that to remove the
breast in one piece well in two pieces
really try to stay as close to the rib
cage as possible so you get most of the
meat
you don't even really need to use a
special knife for this a carving knife
is great but it's not necessary so you
just use a nice sharp knife cut down
along the bottom and you should be able
to remove the breasts all in one piece
do the same thing with the breasts on
the other side
then the wings you can cut through the
joints of the wings as well they should
separate really easy from the carcass at
this point so just use the tip of your
knife to get in between the joints so
that you can separate it you're not ever
really meant to cut through bone when
you're cutting up any kind of poultry
you can also go in there with your
scissors it's a really nice supplemental
tool and just cut it right off keep your
work area clean I've been cleaning up
with paper towels just makes it easier
if there's not a big mess I like to cut
my turkey carcass in half so that it's
not so big in the fridge and then save
it to make soup now you can scrape up
some of these juices and just transfer
them into the pan where you're gonna
make your gravy I just use the side of
my knife to do that now you can just go
ahead and cut up your turkey I'm gonna
do the leg and show you how to do that
I don't usually cut the meat off of the
legs themselves but you can cut between
the leg and the thigh separate those
again you're not cutting through any
bone here and then you can cut the thigh
meat off the bone in my house the thigh
meat is everybody's favorite so we all
fight over it just cut around the bone
getting as close to it as possible and
then you can save these bones to for
your soup then just cut them into slices
I like to keep as much skin intact as
possible
so that's your thigh and leg for the
breast cut your turkey breast into thin
slices this is where the sharp knife is
important because if it's dull it's
gonna just mush the skin around but if
it's nice and sharp you'll get a little
piece of skin on every slice and then
just arrange your turkey how I really
like a little bit of thigh meat you can
do it really however you want just the
breast
I'm actually gonna separate the wings
just a little too big I think from my
platter so just at the joint again you
can separate it there we go and there
you have it wasn't that easy I hope that
it was really helpful and have a great
Thanksgiving
